newsitem.title: FRANCE: Marchais, French ex-Communist leader, in hospital.
newsitem.headline: Marchais, French ex-Communist leader, in hospital.

text.p: Georges Marchais, veteran former leader of the French Communist Party, was taken to hospital on Wednesday suffering from a recurring heart ailment, a party spokesman said.
It was not immediately clear whether his condition was serious. Marchais, 76, has suffered several heart attacks.
A Stalinist hardliner, he ran the Communist Party for more than two decades from 1972.

Under him the once-powerful French party was one of Moscow's staunchest allies in Western Europe. In 1979 he shocked the nation by giving full public backing to the Soviet intervention in Afghanistan.
In 1993, dogged by ill-health, and shaken by the collapse of Soviet rule, he handed over the party reins to the more liberal Robert Hue.

Even after turning over the leadership, however, Marchais remained in the policy-making politburo and was widely seen as heading an old guard of hardliners resisting Hue's efforts to modernise and liberalise the movement.
Last week Marchais announced that he would not seek re-election to parliament at the next general election in 1998.
